description:
Standard PDF Features
The PDFix SDK contains a set of standard PDF features to work with and manipulate PDF documents. This includes features like rasterize, print, comment, review, fill-in forms, watermark, stamp, bookmarks, sign, access low-level object for custom editing.

Logical Content Extraction
Content extraction in PDFix is focused on logical content elements. We use heuristic algorithms to identify structured data objects like paragraphs, tables, figures, headers, footers, etc. As a part of it, we also detect reading order.
The identified logical structure can be used for conversion to structured formats like XML, JSON or HTML. In the case of the HTML, the SDK can generate a “responsive” representation of the PDF - reflowable paragraphs, responsive tables.
The most important benefit is to get a structure behind unstructured data, Most of the PDFs are not tagged or even if they are, the information is not good enough for e.g conversion to HTML or screen readers. A common use case for the logical content extraction is a conversion of the PDF into responsive HTML, which provides better reading experience on small devices. Conversion to JSON, XML is usually used for data exchange.
The extraction algorithm can be configured to allows users to focus on a specific type of content. It also allows users to improve the algorithm to change content detection by the object properties (color, position, size, ...) or even regex expression. This flexibility provides users a wide range of usability for specific document templates and specific content.
Link to a use-case example: https://pdfix.net/use-cases/pdf-to-csv/, https://pdfix.net/use-cases/pdf-to-xml/.

PDF Tagging and Accessibility
The SDK is able to add missing structured information in PDF by tagging it. The auto-tag is based on logical content extraction. The detected structure is used to generate the structure tree in the PDF. The automated tagging is configurable in order to reach a higher quality of the tagged output. For example by defining headings (H1..Hx), Image labels, artifacts, etc.
Using methods to embed fonts, add missing unicode characters, metadata or specifying the title and language the SDK can convert to PDF/UA compliant document.
The SDK allows touch-ups to the document structure tree. Which gives the user an ability to manually create or edit tagged content.  
Link to a use-case example: https://pdfix.net/use-cases/add-tags-to-pdf/.
summary:
PDFix SDK is a cross-platform library for processing and manipulation of PDF documents. The SDK provides an API for c++, c#, java, python or can be integrated using a command-line interface for automated document processing.
The key features of the SDK cover use cases to access and extract pdf data, convert pdf, fill-in pdf forms, make pdf accessible and more.
title: PDFix SDK
